title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=d7cc8834fbf21d8da84189cc06a5b7e1b5677686
comments: Started playing tears of the kingdom. Itâ€™s a great game if you loved BoTW. Although ToTK doesnâ€™t run as smooth :(
Playing valorant on a laptop cant get any better than this trust me.
Hogwarts Legacy, and its amazing ðŸ¤©
Playing through the Assassins Creed series. Played AC4: Black Flag last week, right now on AC1. Canâ€™t wait to move in to the Ezio trilogy.
Playing through the Assassins Creed series. Played AC4: Black Flag last week, right now on AC1. Canâ€™t wait to move in to the Ezio trilogy.
Playing through the Assassins Creed series. Played AC4: Black Flag last week, right now on AC1. Canâ€™t wait to move in to the Ezio trilogy.
It indeed is. What do you play it on ?
Started NFS Heat but somehow it's the story part boring me. I don't care about the story much, just give me a free run and races to complete.
Used to be an avid PC and console gamer, now i am just content with COD Mobile.
